intro: Spathiger ramosus, commonly known as the branched spathiger, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its woody stem and compound leaves, which are arranged in a distinctive, branching pattern. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spathes, giving it its scientific name. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for taxonomic study and ecological research. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes.
